results.title: Ms. Reiko Hitomi, Tokyo
results.creator_credit: Sachiko Kimura, Hiroyuki Kurita, Gian Manara, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Reiko Hitomi is a thirtyish, divorced, single parent who works as an aerobics instructor in Tokyo. The program looks at her decidedly untraditional life, her hopes and dreams as she prepares for an aerobics examination which will give her the essential qualifications to pursue her goal of running her own gym. Introduced by Franca Arena.

results.brief_description: This stylish short animation borrows from the tradition of nastier fairytales. This creepy cautionary fable outlines what can happen to little girls who whine for toys.

group_works.title: Telestreet: the Italian Media Jacking Movement

results.title: Telestreet: the Italian Media Jacking Movement
results.brief_description: “Telestreet” is a network of pirate micro TV transmitters set up by media activists across Italy. Since beginning in June 2002 there are now almost 200 stations throughout the country. This documentary contains interviews with some of those media activists.

results.title: Mary
results.brief_description: ‘Mary’ combines colour film from the early 1950s as well as modern 16mm footage. Scratched and painted upon, this experimental film links timeless images of the ocean with old footage of a young woman. The effect is both mysterious and moody creating an intangible, lingering feeling of melancholy.

results.title: Dissonant particles
results.brief_description:
An abstract animation based on experiments with sound. Gordon describes the work as follows “Psychoacoustic experiments have indicated that two pure sine tones are played simultaneously, they will sound most dissonant when they are around a semitone apart in pitch. In Dissonant Particles, each particle emits a sine tone. The dissonance between them acts as a repulsive force that pushes the particles apart, both in position and in pitch. There is also a long-range (“cosmological”) attractive force that prevents the particles from flying off to infinity. The particles pulsate and slowly evaporate; both of these processes affect the way they “feel” the forces acting on them. The colour of a particle indicates pitch: red for low pitches, green for intermediate, and blue for high. The camera tracks one particle, which is always shown in the centre of the screen.”
Psycho acoustics is the study of subjective experience of audio versus the scientific measurement of sound by various devices. For example, the frequency of a signal may not change but we may perceive pitch changes if the amplitude changes.
http://www.gordonmonro.com/pieces/dissparticles.html

results.title: Deadly Treadlies: out bush
results.brief_description:
Deadly Treadlies is a bike-rebuilding project that has operated out of Alice Springs, in local town camps and in remote Aboriginal communities since January 2003. The project was initiated in response to young people identifying bikes as a popular alternative to petrol sniffing and other substance and solvent abuse. The project has worked with over 500 young people since its inception in local town camps, schools, drop-in centres and on remote communities. In conjunction with the bike building, a series of video workshops were run and Deadly Treadlies uses footage taken by young people from Santa Teresa, Papunya and Titjikala communities.
More info at http://www.asyass.org.au

results.title: Herpes: 400,000 new cases each year
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “60 Minutes”.
Describes the physical symptoms and consequences of the disease as well as the emotional trauma it can trigger. Groups of sufferers relate their feelings of hurt, bewilderment, anger and so discuss a highly sensitive and topical subject.

results.title: In the mainstream
results.creator_credit: Carousel Films and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “60 Minutes”.
Examines the new law in the United States whereby handicapped children must wherever possible, be mainstreamed, that is, educated in the classroom along with other children. Looks at how the new law is working - successful in some cases but a failure in others
